intro: Collinsia bartsiifolia var. alba, commonly known as the white fairy bell, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of California. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in coastal climates with mild, wet winters. It produces small, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
